info.title: OpenML API
info.description: REST API for sharing, organizing and reusing machine learning datasets, code, and experiments. Follows a predictive URL scheme from endpoint http://www.openml.org/api_new/v1/json (or /xml). You need to add your `api_key` to every call (see your account settings), or simply log in.

get.description: Returns information about a dataset. The information includes the name, information about the creator, URL to download it and more.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

delete.description: Deletes a dataset. Upon success, it returns the ID of the deleted dataset.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the deleted dataset, a positive integer

post.description: Uploads a dataset. Upon success, it returns the data id.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: An XML file describing the dataset. Only name, description, and data format are required. Also see the [XSD schema](https://github.com/openml/website/blob/master/openml_OS/views/pages/rest_api/xsd/openml.data.upload.xsd)

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: The actual dataset, being an ARFF file.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the uploaded dataset, a positive integer

get.description: Returns the features of a dataset.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: All the features of the dataset

get.description: Returns the qualities of a dataset.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: All the qualities of the dataset

get.description: Returns an array with all datasets in the system.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: The id of the tagged dataset

parameters.name: data_id
parameters.description: Id of the dataset.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: A the features of the dataset

get.description: Returns information about a flow. The information includes the name, information about the creator, dependencies, parameters, run instructions and more.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the flow.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

delete.description: Deletes a flow. Upon success, it returns the ID of the deleted flow.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the flow.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the deleted flow, a positive integer

post.description: Uploads a flow. Upon success, it returns the flow id.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: An XML file describing the flow. Only name and description are required. Also see the [XSD schema](https://github.com/openml/website/blob/master/openml_OS/views/pages/rest_api/xsd/openml.implementation.upload.xsd)

parameters.name: flow
parameters.description: The actual flow, being a source (or binary) file.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the uploaded flow, a positive integer

get.description: Checks whether a flow with the given name and (external) version exists.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the flow.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The external version of the flow

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

id.description: The id of the flow with the given name and (external) version

get.description: Returns an array with all flows in the system.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all flows owned by you.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

parameters.name: flow_id
parameters.description: Id of the flow.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: The id of the tagged flow

parameters.name: flow_id
parameters.description: Id of the flow.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: The id of the untagged flow

get.description: Returns information about a run. The information includes the name, information about the creator, dependencies, parameters, run instructions and more.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the run.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

delete.description: Deletes a run. Upon success, it returns the ID of the deleted run.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the run.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the deleted run, a positive integer

post.description: Uploads a run. Upon success, it returns the run id.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: An XML file describing the run

parameters.name: predictions
parameters.description: The predictions generated by the run

parameters.name: model_readable
parameters.description: The human-readable model generated by the run

parameters.name: model_serialized
parameters.description: The serialized model generated by the run

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the uploaded run, a positive integer

get.description: Returns an array with all runs matching the given run id(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of run IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all runs belonging to one of the given task(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all runs uploaded by one of the given user(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all runs generated by the given flow(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.summary: Get runs by id, task, uploader and/or flow
get.description: Returns an array with all runs matching any or all of the given filters. You can combine any of the four above filters any way you want.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Any combination of filters (run,task,uploader and/or flow) and corresponding comma-separated IDs, e.g. 'run/1,2,3/uploader/1' or 'task/1,2,3/flow/1,2'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: Id of the run.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: The id of the tagged run

parameters.name: run_id
parameters.description: Id of the run.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Tag name

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Api key to authenticate the user

200.description: The id of the untagged run

get.description: Returns an array with all evaluations matching the given run id(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of run IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all evaluations belonging to one of the given task(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of task IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all evaluations uploaded by one of the given user(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.description: Returns an array with all evaluations generated by the given flow(s).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs, e.g. '1,2,3'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

get.summary: Get evaluations by run, task, uploader and or flow
get.description: Returns an array with all evaluations matching any or all of the given filters. You can combine any of the four above filters any way you want.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Any combination of filters (run,task,uploader and/or flow) and corresponding comma-separated IDs, e.g. 'run/1,2,3/uploader/1' or 'task/1,2,3/flow/1,2'.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: API key to authenticate the user

id.description: ID of the flow, a positive integer

version.description: The version of the flow, set by OpenML. A positive integer

version_label.description: The version of the flow, as defined by the uploader, for reference. Can be any format as long as it is unique.

description.description: Wiki description of the flow, in (Git flavoured) markdown format

upload_date.description: The datetime that the flow was uploaded, format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

language.description: The programming language the flow is written in.

dependencies.description: The libraries that this flow depends on, and their version numbers.

tag.description: Tags added by OpenML users. Includes study tags in the form `study_1`

data_type.description: The data type of the parameter

default_value.description: The default value of the parameter

full_name.description: The full flow name (name + internal version number)

uploader.description: The ID of the person who uploaded the flow

status.description: The dataset status, either in_preparation, active, or deactivated

name.description: The name of the dataset quality measures

is_target.description: Whether this feature is seen as a target feature

is_ignore.description: Whether this feature should be ignored in modelling (e.g. every value is unique)

is_row_identifier.description: Whether this feature is a row identifier

id.description: ID of the dataset, a positive integer

version.description: The version of the dataset, set by OpenML. A positive integer

description.description: Wiki description of the dataset, in (Git flavoured) markdown format

upload_date.description: The datetime that the dataset was uploaded, format yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss

licence.description: The licence granted for using the dataset, for instance Public or CC-BY

url.description: The URL where the data can be downloaded

file_id.description: The ID of the dataset file stored on the OpenML server

default_target_attribute.description: For tabular data, the name of the column that is typically used as the target attribute for that data set

version_label.description: The version of the dataset, as defined by the uploader, for reference. Can be any format as long as it is unique.

tag.description: Tags added by OpenML users. Includes study tags in the form `study_1`

visibility.description: Who can see the dataset. For instance `public`.

original_data_url.description: The URL where the original data is hosted.

md5_checksum.description: Checksum to verify downloads of the dataset

task_id.description: The ID of the task solved by this run

setup_id.description: Ignore (internal representation of the parameter setting)

flow_id.description: The ID of the flow used in this run

uploader.description: The ID of the person uploading this run

error_message.description: Error message generated by the run (if any)

task_id.description: The ID of the tasks solved by this run

flow_id.description: The ID of the flow used by this run

function.description: The name of the evaluation function

array_data.description: For structured evaluation measures, an array of evaluation values (e.g. per-class predictions, evaluation matrices,...)

id.description: ID of the run, a positive integer

uploader_name.description: The name of the uploader of the run

task_id.description: The id of the task solved by this run

task_type.description: The type of task solved by this run (e.g., classification)

task_evaluation_measure.description: The evaluation measure that is supposed to be optimized in the task, if any

flow_id.description: The id of the flow used in this run

flow_name.description: The name of the flow used in this run

setup_string.description: Configuration of the flow as a string, to be interpreted by the flow, its library, or command line interface.

tag.description: Tags added by OpenML users. Includes study tags in the form `study_1`

items.description: Parameter settings used in this run. Can be multiple.

value.description: The value of the parameter used

input_data.description: The input data for this run.

url.description: The download url of the dataset

output_data.description: The data generated by this run.

items.description: Files uploaded by the user, e.g. run description, predictions. Can be multiple.

did.description: The id of the uploaded file

file_id.description: The reference id of the uploaded file, for downloading afterward

name.description: The name of the uploaded file (e.g., description, predictions, model,...)

items.description: Evaluations uploaded by the user, e.g. runtimes, or computed by the server (after run upload). Can be multiple.

name.description: The name of the evaluation measure

flow_id.description: The id of the code used to compute this evaluation method

array_data.description: For composite evaluation measures (e.g. per-class measures, confusion matrix), a string (JSON) representation of the evaluation.
